data.title: A different wife for John I of England

data.text:
In otl, John I was married to Isabella Countess of Gloucester in 1189, after having been betrothed to her in 1176, however, due to being within the forbidden degrees of consanguinity, and for whatever reason, the Pope declared they could remain wed, but could not have sexual relations, therefore there were no children from this marriage, forcing John to get an annulment in 1199 upon his ascension to the throne, he would later marry Isabella Countess of Angouleme and have issue with her.

What I am wondering is, other than the COuntess of Gloucester, who else are potential wives for John?

So far I've found Alice De Vere, daughter of the 1st Earl of Oxford

Isabel de Clare, Countess of Pembroke

Any other suggestions?

My idea is to marry him to Dulce II of Provence or Constance of Sicily, the OTL Holy Roman Empress..

Interesting why one of those two?

Douce II of Provence is the heiress of Provence who died Betrothed to the brother in law of an elder sister of John, Raymond of Toulouse, she was the fiance of Raymond before her death and it also unites the claims of Eleanor and Douce to Provence, she is similar to Isabella of Angouleme just 2-3 decades older, I see her taking the name Eleanor after marriage.

Constance of Sicily would make an excellent wife because it would can give him sicily

He would likely have a son that is older or the same age as arthur if he marries one of those two..

the other choice would be Isabella of Jerusalem..

How does this sound for John:

John I of England, Duke of Normandy, Duke of Aquitaine, Count of Main and Count of Anjou (b. 1166: d. 1216)

Wife: Dulce of Provence

Children: Henry, (b.1195)

Richard (b. 1198)

Eleanor (b. 1200)

Matilda (b. 1202)

It is more like this

John I of England, Duke of Normandy, Duke of Aquitaine, Count of Main and Count of Anjou, Count of Toulouse, Margrave of Provence (b. 1166: d. 1216)

Wife: Dulce II of Provence b. 1165

Children: Henry, (b.1187) m. Isabella of Angouleme (b. 1288)

Blanche (b. 1190)

Richard (b. 1192)

Eleanor (b. 1195)

Matilda (b. 1200)

Oh interesting. So by the time of the Baron's Revolt, if it still happens Henry will have children of his own

Yes, he will...the question is how they will deal with Arthur but that is after their uncle, Richard had already sent Eleanor of Brittany and Matilda of Brittany to HRE and Burgundy
